intro: Amylotheca revoluta, commonly known as the spiral moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to brownish-gray foliage. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a revolute (rolled under) margin, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on soil or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Amylotheca revoluta is a cryptogamic plant that reproduces via spores, contributing to the biodiversity of forest and woodland ecosystems.
